    • Uses of FloatInputPoll in ccre.channel

      Subinterfaces of FloatInputPoll in ccre.channel 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  FloatInput
      A FloatInput is a way to get the current state of a float input, and to subscribe to notifications of changes in the float input's value.
      Classes in ccre.channel that implement FloatInputPoll 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  FloatStatus
      A virtual node that is both a FloatOutput and a FloatInput.
      Methods in ccre.channel that return FloatInputPoll 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FloatInputPoll FloatFilter.wrap(FloatInputPoll input)
      Returns a FloatInputPoll representing the filtered version of the specified input.

      Returns a FloatInputPoll representing the negated version of the specified input.
      static FloatInputPoll FloatMixing.normalizeFloat(FloatInputPoll base, float zero, float one)
      Returns a scaled version of the specified input, such that when the value from the specified input is the value in the one parameter, the output is 1.0, and when the value from the specified input is the value in the zero parameter, the output is 0.0.

      Returns a four-way select based on two BooleanInputPolls from four floats.
